contents.label: title
contents.text: Description/Specifications/Work Statement for Regulatory Scrapie Slaughter Surveillance (RSSS) Whole Head Collection Sites Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)Veterinary Services (VS)

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: 1. Any sheep (regardless of face color) or goat that is from 18 months of age up to72 months of age (i.e. under 7 yrs.) as evidenced by examination of the teeth. A sheep or goat will be considered 18 month or over if the second permanent incisor is erupted and over 72 months of age if the 4h permanent incisor is fully erupted and there are broken， missing， blunt， elongated， splayed teeth， or other significant signs of dental wear present. (As a guide， of those heads determined to be over 4 years of age， less than 30 percent should be 5 years of age.)

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: 2. Any mature sheep or goat that exhibits any of the following clinical signs：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: A. Dead prior to slaughter or condemned on ante-mortem inspection.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: C. Signs of central nervous system (CNS) disease including：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: D. Intense rubbing， abrasions， or rough， thickened， and/or hyperpigmented skin：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: A. with an SFCP tag (up to 30 animals cumulative per flock or herd， i.e. not on the "Do Not Collect" list)； or

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: B. that are received on a VS 1-27 permit (e.g. scrapie-exposed animals that are not in source or infected flocks， identified by yellow "exposed" eartag)； or

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: 4. Any sheep or goats when directed in writing by the APHIS contact.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Refer to the attached RSSS Targeted Criteria Flowchart
